title: Kenshi Yonezu‚Äôs ‚ÄòIRIS OUT‚Äô Logs 13th Week at No. 1 as ‚ÄòKohaku‚Äô Performances Fuel Multiple Songs on Japan Hot¬†100
summary: Debuting at No. 2 is Kis-My-Ft2‚Äôs ‚Äú&Joy.‚Äù
body: Kenshi Yonezu ‚Äôs domination of the Billboard Japan Hot 100 continues as ‚ÄúIRIS OUT‚Äù holds at No. 1 on the chart released Jan. 7. The Chainsaw Man ‚Äì The Movie: Reze Arc theme stays atop the tally for a third consecutive week, extending its run to 13 total weeks at No. 1. Weekly streaming rises for a fourth straight week, while downloads surge to 240% of the prior frame. Debuting at No. 2 is Kis-My-Ft2‚Äôs ‚Äú&Joy.‚Äù The group‚Äôs 33rd single sold 94,748 CDs to lead sales, while placing at No. 36 for radio. At No. 3 is HANA‚Äôs ‚ÄúBlue Jeans,‚Äù up three spots from last week. Momentum continues for the breakout girl group following their New Artist Award win at the Japan Record Awards and their first appearance on the year-end live music celebration Kohaku Uta Gassen. Eight songs by the act land on the chart, with seven posting gains: ‚ÄúROSE‚Äù climbs 9-4, ‚ÄúNON STOP‚Äù comes in at No. 11, ‚ÄúMy Body‚Äù moves 30-22, ‚ÄúTiger‚Äù 34-27, ‚ÄúDrop‚Äù 41-30, ‚ÄúBAD LOVE‚Äù 38-33, and ‚ÄúBurning Flower‚Äù 50-35. Chanmina ‚Äî the rapper/singer who produced HANA ‚Äî also places four songs on the chart: ‚ÄúSAD SONG‚Äù rises 81-36, ‚ÄúHarenchi‚Äù 66-44, ‚ÄúSAD SONG – From THE FIRST TAKE feat. No No Girls FINALISTS‚Äù places at No. 67, and‚Ä¶

title: OnePlus just launched two phones with huge 9,000 mAh batteries
summary: The US wants big batteries, too.
body: TL;DR The OnePlus Turbo 6 and Turbo 6V have launched in China. Both phones feature 9,000 mAh batteries, high-refresh rate displays, and midrange Snapdragon chipsets. We don‚Äôt have information about international availability. OnePlus has been teasing the release of phones under a new Turbo brand for almost a month now , and just last week, the company confirmed a few important details about its new OnePlus Turbo 6 series: two models, both featuring 9,000 mAh batteries, midrange Snapdragon chipsets, and more. Those phones is now up for purchase, though only in China. NotebookCheck spotted today that the OnePlus Turbo 6 and Turbo 6V are now live on OnePlus‚Äôs Chinese site. There isn‚Äôt much surprising here, aside from maybe the prices: the new Turbo 6 features some capable specs starting at CNY 2,099, or about $300, while the Turbo 6V is CNY 1,899, about $270.

title: Karol G, Be√©le & More: Here‚Äôs the Ultimate ‚ÄòNew Year, New Me‚Äô Latin¬†Playlist
summary: From Karol G's "Milagros" to B√©ele's "algo bueno," here's a feel-good Latin playlist to kick off 2026.
body: With 2026 in full swing, there‚Äôs no doubt that the ‚Äúnew year, new me‚Äù mentality has kicked in. And as tradition holds, Billboard has curated the ultimate playlist to kickstart your year on a strong and positive note. Titled ‚ÄúNew Year, New Me: El 2026 Playlist,‚Äù the list includes more than one hour of feel-good music, mainly charged with powerful affirmations turned into lyrics. In songs such as Karol G‚Äôs ‚ÄúMilagros,‚Äù Bad Bunny‚Äôs ‚ÄúEstamos Bien‚Äù and ‚ÄúBendecido‚Äù by Dale Pututi and Gente de Zona’s Randy Malcom, the artists share sentiments about feeling at peace, being blessed in their personal lives and having successful careers. Be√©le‚Äôs ‚ÄúAlgo Bueno,‚Äù Elena Rose‚Äôs ‚ÄúLa De Dios,‚Äù and Yami Safdie and Camilo‚Äôs ‚ÄúQuerida Yo,‚Äù on the other hand, are tracks that reflect on self-love, evolution and the importance of manifestation because the best is yet to come. ‚ÄúEvil wants to trap me, but it won’t succeed/ I have angels protecting me, where there’s a will there’s a way/ It’s never too late to be reborn/ You will always see the best part of me,” Be√©le sings on his smooth Afrobeats track. Moreover, the playlist has empowering songs that are about shining brig‚Ä¶

title: Soundtrack to Baz Luhrmann‚Äôs ‚ÄòEPiC: Elvis Presley in Concert‚Äô Film to Feature Live Performance, Remixes and Medleys of¬†Classics
summary: The 27-track album from Sony Legacy and RCA Records is due out on Feb. 20.
body: The soundtrack to director Baz Luhrmann’s upcoming EPiC: Elvis Presley Live in Concert film will be released by Sony Legacy Recordings and RCA Records on Feb. 20. The 27-track collection of songs heard in the film will feature a combination of updated remixes of signature live recordings alongside new remixes and medleys of classic songs from Presley, including Jamieson Shaw remixes of “In the Ghetto” and “Love Me” and a PNAU remix of “Don’t Fly Away.” The soundtrack will drop on the same day as the theatrical premiere of the movie that will have a one-week exclusive IMAX run, which will be followed by a global theatrical release from NEON and Universal Pictures on Feb. 27. According to a release, during the making of his 2022 Elvis biopic, Luhrmann and his team found a treasure trove of long-hidden film negatives and footage in the Warner Brothers vault from the Elvis docs Elvis: The Way It Is (a chronicle of the rock icon’s August 1970 Las Vegas residency) and Elvis On Tour (which captured the singer’s 1972 U.S. tour), in addition to never-before-seen 8mm footage and never-before-heard audio of Elvis musing about his li‚Ä¶

title: David Bowie‚Äôs Childhood Home to Open to the¬†Public
summary: The announcement of the acquisition comes on what would have been the late star's 79th birthday.
body: Before he became David Bowie , he was David Jones. He lived at a modest traditional British home in southeast London that had a living and dining room/kitchen downstairs, and two bedrooms upstairs with his family, and dreamed of becoming a musical great. That fabled house, 4 Plaistow Grove in Bromley, is now set to be a place of pilgrimage for Bowie fans when it is restored and reopened to the public in the coming years. The home, where Bowie lived between ages 8 and 20, has been acquired by the Heritage of London Trust in a landmark purchase. The premises will restore the house back to its original early 1960s appearance and is set to open to the public in late 2027.  Bowie was born in Brixton, south London, and moved to the property with his mother and father in 1955. He lived at the premises until 1967, around the time that he released his self-titled debut album on Decca Records, though he returned often in the following years. The announcement of the heritage project comes on what would have been Bowie‚Äôs 79th birthday (Jan. 8), and just days before the 10th anniversary of his Jan. 10, 2016, passing. The acquisition follows the opening of the Victoria & Albert Museum‚Äô‚Ä¶

title: How Rare Is It for a Country Song by a Woman to Reach the Top 10 of the Hot¬†100?
summary: Ella Langley is the 12th woman to chart a country song in the top 10 since 2000.
body: On the latest Billboard Hot 100 (dated Jan. 10), Ella Langley surges from No. 48 to No. 5 with ‚ÄúChoosin‚Äô Texas.‚Äù The song, released in October, began gaining momentum late last year before being stalled by the annual flood of holiday titles that dominate the chart in December. Related Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Fate of Ophelia‚Äô Becomes Her Sole Longest-Leading Hot 100 Hit, Surpassing ‚ÄòAnti-Hero‚Äô With Her No-Filter Songs, Ella Langley Is Making Country Music With No ‚ÄòDamn Rulebook‚Äô Parmalee’s ‘Cowgirl’ Hits 4 Weeks Atop Country Airplay Chart: How Rare Is That Among Groups? Now that holiday music has retreated from the Hot 100 for the season, ‚ÄúChoosin‚Äô Texas‚Äù accelerates into the top five, earning Langley her first career top 10 hit. In the process, she joins a notably small group of women to score a top 10 Hot 100 hit this century with a country song. Just how rare is that feat? Dating back to 2000, only 12 women or all-female groups have charted in the Hot 100‚Äôs top 10 with a country song, defined as songs eligible for Billboard ‚Äôs Hot Country Songs chart. And across the past 26 years, just 24 country songs by women have reached the top tier of the Hot 10‚Ä¶

title: Tapered Candles Are Bringing Serious Drip to Dining Rooms
summary: I‚Äôve noticed something bright and comforting, even in the moodiest of dining rooms across the country: real candles, and lots of them. After a long reign of battery-powered faux candles for safety and convenience, some restaurants are back to scattering demure tea candles in votives across their ta‚Ä¶

title: Billboard‚Äôs Music Industry Events¬†Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. Jan. 11 – Sync Songwriter Music Supervisor Panel (virtual) Jan. 14 – European Festival Awards (Groningen, The Netherlands) Jan. 14-17 – Eurosonic Noorderslag (Groningen, The Netherlands) Jan. 15-Feb. 7 – Igloofest Montr√©al festival (Montreal) Jan. 17 – iHeartRadio ALTer EGO festival (Los Angeles) Jan. 17-‚Ä¶

title: Best of CES 2026: Android Authority‚Äôs top products from the show!
summary: Here are the Android Authority Best of CES 2026 Award winners.
body: A new year means a fresh CES, and once again Las Vegas turned into tech central for CES 2026 . Our team spent the week on the ground, walking the show floors, chasing down announcements, and getting hands-on with as many products as humanly possible. Nobody can see everything at CES, since the show is massive, but we focused on the gear that genuinely stood out. This year brought big upgrades in smart home tech, plenty of creative ideas in mobile and wearables, smarter displays, and a few products that simply put a smile on our faces.

title: Android‚Äôs time zone change notification might not leave you guessing anymore
summary: And save you legwork of figuring out manually.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Android 16 QPR2 recently got the option to inform you when your phone‚Äôs clock automatically adjusts to a new time zone. With a future update, your Android device may also tell you the exact time your clock has moved. This will save time trying to figure out the time difference yourself. With Android 16 QPR2 , which rolled out last month, Google introduced alerts every time your phone automatically switches to a new timezone . However, the feature doesn‚Äôt tell you exactly how many hours or minutes your clocks shifted, which can make you take an extra step to look it up on Google if you‚Äôre unaware of the exact time difference or want to figure out the time where your journey originated. But Google now appears to have reconsidered and might soon fill that vacuum. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. You may‚Ä¶

title: Android 17‚Äôs new App Lock might stop your notifications from spilling secrets
summary: Latest Android Canary reveals Google plans to mask notifications by replacing their content with generic placeholder text.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Android 17 is rumored to include a native App Lock feature. New code strings suggest that locked app notifications will show generic ‚ÄúNew message‚Äù or ‚ÄúNew notification‚Äù text instead of the usual notification content. It‚Äôs unclear whether the app name and icon in the notification will also be hidden. We‚Äôre slowly and steadily marching towards the release of Android 17 , which could come with new features such as a long-awaited native App Lock solution. We already have a decent idea of how this rumored feature would work, but there were a few unknowns, one of which was how the feature would handle incoming notifications from locked apps. Thanks to the Android Canary 2601 release , we have an answer. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. You may unsubscribe at any time. Within this new Android Canary build, ‚Ä¶

title: CES 2026: Segway Navimow‚Äôs latest robotic lawn mowers are ‚Äúdrop and mow‚Äù ready
summary: Segway Navimow unveiled its latest robot lawn mowers, featuring significant performance and feature upgrades.
body: Credit: Navimow Beautiful, picture-perfect lawns and backyards look fantastic, but anyone who has had to drag around a heavy lawn mower knows how difficult and time-consuming they are to maintain. And even if you went the robot lawn mower route before, installing base stations and perimeter wires is another complicated and tedious chore. Segway Navimow addresses both of these concerns and more with their latest robot lawn mowers. Navimow showed off five new lineups at CES 2026 ‚Äì four ideal for residential use, while a new series marks the brand‚Äôs first foray into commercial lawn mowing. The i2, H2, X4, and Terranox series address very different yard types, from simple suburban lawns to complex, obstacle-dense landscapes and extreme terrain. And most importantly, they make lawn maintenance a breeze.

title: I turned my Pixel 10 Pro into a 2026 BlackBerry and LG Wing ‚Äî seriously
summary: Keyboard cases aren't my thing, but the Clicks Power Keyboard has my attention.
body: For the last couple of years, Clicks has been one of the more interesting brands in the mobile accessory space. After creating keyboard cases for various iPhone and Android phone models, the company came to CES 2026 to showcase something a little different: a keyboard you can attach to any smartphone, without the commitment of a full-on case. It‚Äôs called the Clicks Power Keyboard, and it snaps onto the back of your phone via MagSafe/Qi2 magnets ‚Äî instantly turning your phone into a modern-day BlackBerry. Compared to Clicks‚Äô keyboard cases , the Power Keyboard has a couple of key benefits: 1) You can attach and remove the Clicks Power Keyboard much more easily than a case, and 2) it allows the keyboard to be attach to any phone that has magnets, whether built into it or via a compatible case.

title: Samsung concludes Galaxy Ring investigation after swelling sent user to hospital
summary: Samsung says cracked molding, not battery, was to blame for the incident.
body: Credit: X/@ZONEofTECH TL;DR Samsung has completed its investigation into an incident that sent tech creator Daniel (@ZONEofTECH) to the hospital last year. The company states that the swelling in Daniel‚Äôs Galaxy Ring was caused by a crack in its internal molding, not the battery. Samsung and an independent agency both reached the same conclusion. Samsung has officially concluded its investigation into a Galaxy Ring incident that sent a tech creator to the hospital in October last year. The company has reportedly determined that the issue was caused by a crack in the Galaxy Ring‚Äôs internal molding, confirming that the device doesn‚Äôt pose any wider battery safety risks.

title: Your Android-powered car will get faster updates thanks to Qualcomm
summary: Does your car have Android Automotive? There might be good news for you.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Qualcomm has announced a partnership with Google for a ‚Äúunified reference platform‚Äù for Android Automotive OS, starting with Android 17. This means cars with Android Automotive and Snapdragon chips should get quicker access to new Google features. The chipmaker also announced that Project Treble is coming to cars with Snapdragon chips, speeding up system updates. Cars with Android Automotive OS offer a standalone Android experience without having to pair with an Android device. Now, Google and Qualcomm have announced some welcome developments in this space. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here!
summary: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here, and there are a couple of changes worth knowing.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has released the January 2026 Android Canary build. We‚Äôve found evidence that this software could bring Quick Share/AirDrop integration to Pixel 9 phones. We also spotted a few other visual changes compared to previous releases. Google regularly offers Android Canary builds, allowing users to try new features and changes before they‚Äôre broadly released. Google launched the December 2025 Android Canary build a month ago, and it‚Äôs wasting no time in launching its first build of 2026. The company just released the January 2026 Android Canary build, dubbed Android Canary 2601. This build has the version number ZP11.251212.007.

title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarctica‚Äôs Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular berg‚Äîone of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientists‚Äîis sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Island‚Äîabout 4,000 square kilometers. Estimates from the U.S. National Ice Center put the berg‚Äôs area at 1,182 squa‚Ä¶

title: CES 2026: Narwal‚Äôs latest flagship vacuum robot headlines its next-generation smart cleaning product lineup
summary: At CES 2026, Narwal showcases it's latest flagship robot vacuum, new cordless handheld vacuums, and a mattress vacuum.
body: Narwal is a staple at tech shows like CES and IFA, and the popular smart home cleaning brand is kicking off 2026 with its latest flagship robot vacuum, the Narwal Flow 2 . Featuring a new design, significantly upgraded AI-powered features, an improved mopping system, and more power than ever before, the Narwal Flow 2 sets the standard in automated home cleaning. And that‚Äôs not all! Along with the flagship robot, Narwal is expanding into other categories, including cordless and mattress vacuums. Here‚Äôs everything you need to know. Narwal Flow 2: The 2026 flagship robot vacuum with the most powerful AI system

title: Survey shows most of you don‚Äôt like Remix in Google Messages
summary: About half of survey respondents wish they could disable the feature altogether.
body: Google Messages rolled out a Nano Banana-powered Remix feature late last year, letting users make AI edits to images sent and received right inside app. The implementation was heavy-handed, with a prominent Remix button displayed whenever you view an image in Messages full-size. Last month, we asked how you all felt about it ‚Äî and overwhelmingly, you told us you‚Äôre not into it. In a poll conducted by Android Authority , more than 1,000 readers have cast votes voicing their opinions on the Remix feature. A whopping 47% of respondents said they don‚Äôt like Remix, and that they wished the feature could be disabled.

title: Facer introduces Face Chime and other new features, expansion to RTOS watches
summary: Face Chime, new integrations, and new platforms ‚Äî a big year for Facer.
body: TL;DR Smartwatch face platform Facer made a few announcements at CES today. Facer will soon be available on some RTOS-based wearables. A new Face Chime feature allows watch face makers to add custom hourly chimes to their faces. Smartwatch face platform Facer announced a handful of notable updates at CES today. The popular custom watch face creator and marketplace is expanding to more smartwatch platforms, and Facer faces are getting new capabilities, including a handy hourly chime option. Facer is expanding to RTOS watches soon. Facer will be pre-installed on Reebok‚Äôs upcoming Kinetic smartwatch (seen in images here), which will run on VitalOS with MicroEJ VEE Wear. The company‚Äôs also partnering with free and open-source graphics library LVGL, an integration that‚Äôll see Facer watch faces available on RTOS-based watches from a number of brands, including Xiaomi.

title: CES 2026 just saw a game-changing 3D printer with multi-material and color abilities
summary: This 3D printer can handle multiple colors and materials, is whisper quiet, and is wildly efficient.
body: Credit: AtomForm TL;DR AtomForm has unveiled its latest 3D printer, the Palette 300. This 3D printer features 12 nozzles, allowing it to combine up to 36 colors and 12 materials in a single print. It also cuts waste by up to 90%, helping to reduce swap times. The Palette 300 will become available in early Q2 2026, with pre-orders starting in early Q1 2026. As expected, CES 2026 has been full of unique and interesting product announcements, ranging from a fuzzy emotional support buddy to the world‚Äôs first wireless 7.1.4 Dolby Atmos system . One announcement that shouldn‚Äôt be overlooked involves a 3D printer that offers something you won‚Äôt find on other 3D printers. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Mammotion‚Äôs new lineup wants to save you from having to rescue your outdoor robots
summary: Mammotion brings real autonomy to your yard with LUBA 3 and SPINO S1 Pro.
body: Credit: Mammotion TL;DR Mammotion showed off two flagship robots at CES 2026 that aim to remove manual lawn mowing and pool cleaning almost entirely. The LUBA 3 mower combines all-wheel drive with upgraded Tri-Fusion Navigation, including 360¬∞ LiDAR, dual-camera AI vision, and NetRTK for ¬±1 cm accuracy. The SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner features AutoShoreCharge, a robotic arm system that automatically lifts the unit out of the water and docks it for charging. Outdoor maintenance can be tough. Wrestling with a mower on a steep hill or pulling a heavy pool cleaner from the water makes the dream of a perfect yard feel like hard work. Mammotion wants to change that, and its CES 2026 showcase shows it‚Äôs almost there. The company is doubling down on its ‚Äútrue hands-free‚Äù philosophy, introducing two new flagship robots: the LUBA 3 lawn mower and the SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner.

title: Tired of losing earbuds? OnePlus could introduce a new feature to help
summary: OnePlus may have come up with a cure for your fear of losing an earbud.
body: Credit: Lil Katz / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus and OPPO could introduce a new feature to their earbuds that automatically detects when an earbud drops out of your ear. If you lose an earbud, your earbuds will play a sound and an alert will be sent to your phone that will help you find the fallen earbud. You may not receive an alert if the ‚ÄúNotifications‚Äù permission is turned off or the app is terminated. Have you ever lost an earbud because it unexpectedly fell out of your ear? OnePlus and OPPO appear to be working on a new feature that could help save you from suffering such a fate again. This unreleased feature is called ‚ÄúEarbud fall dete‚Ä¶

title: T-Mobile just announced its first fee increase of the year: Here‚Äôs what is changing
summary: It might not be a massive increase, but it's the second of its kind in less than a full year's time.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is raising its Regulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee by $0.50 per line starting January 21. Combined with the $.50 hike in April of 2025, fees are up about $1 in less than a year. The vague fee structure continues to draw criticism, though grandfathered plans with taxes and fees included are unaffected. Earlier today, T-Mobile unveiled its new Better Value Plan, promising a better experience for new and existing customers who switch to it. Like every plan offered by T-Mobile these days, this one doesn‚Äôt include taxes and fees. That‚Äôs become important for T-Mobile, as separate charges mean it is much easier to increase customer spending without officially raising prices by simply increasing said fees. We‚Äôve already seen the company increase its telco fees as recently as last April, but it looks like the company is doing it again. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Messages‚Äô new one-handed-friendly menu begins rollout
summary: It‚Äôs a small change, but it should makes everyday actions less awkward on big phones.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google Messages‚Äô new context menu, which we first spotted being tested in October, is now rolling out widely in beta. The menu moves key actions below the selected message, making one-handed use easier on larger phones. Early feedback appears to be largely positive. Back in October, we spotted Google testing a redesigned context menu in Messages. We didn‚Äôt know when or even if it would roll out, though it seemed like a sure thing given its utility for one-handed phone use ‚Äî especially on some of the large-screen flagships on the market. It took a while, but now it appears that the change is starting to roll out more widely. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: T-Mobile‚Äôs new Better Value Plan promises value its rivals can‚Äôt beat, but will it deliver?
summary: While it's still far from cheap, this truly is a better value than Essentials and even Experience More.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is introducing a new Better Value Plan, which requires at least three lines and starts at $140 a month. The new plan also requires at least two lines to be ported in for new customers, or for customers to have been with T-Mobile for five years. The Better Value Plan has impressive perks that actually compare favorably with Experience More, for around the same price. While T-Mobile is still arguably the best value in the postpaid wireless market , the gap between it and its rivals has narrowed over the last few years as the Un-Carrier has increasingly mirrored competitors on pricing and overall value. Likely in an effort to push back against that perception, T-Mobile has announced a new value-focused plan it claims AT&T and Verizon can‚Äôt compete with. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Spotify adds real-time listening activity to Messages, with group chats coming soon
summary: There's also a new Request to Jam feature, making it easier to start shared listening sessions with friends.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Spotify Messages now offers an opt-in Listening activity feature, allowing connected friends and family to see what you are playing in real-time. A new Request to Jam button has been added to chats, making it easier to coordinate and start remote shared listening sessions. The features are rolling out to iOS and Android users in markets where Messages is enabled. Group chat support is planned for the near future. Spotify rolled out a Messages feature in August last year, and today, the company is expanding its functionality with Listening Activity and Request to Jam. Listening activity is an opt-in feature that allows Spotify users to display the music they‚Äôre currently listening to within Spotify Messages in real-time. If you‚Äôre not actively listening, your most recently played song will be displayed instead.

title: Beatbot‚Äôs AquaSense X shows how far robotic pool care has come at CES 2026
summary: The latest robotic pool-cleaning robots from Beatbot take automation to the next level.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority CES has a habit of shining a spotlight on subtly game-changing tech categories. Every year, alongside the headline-grabbing TVs, laptops, and smart home gadgets, there are products that don‚Äôt always get the same attention but still shape everyday life. Pool care is one of them. For years, robotic pool cleaners have promised convenience, but many still require a fair amount of hands-on effort once the cleaning is done. At CES 2026, Beatbot is using that gap as an opportunity to rethink what modern pool care can look like. One of the global leaders in robotic pool cleaning is unveiling two new products at the show: the flagship Beatbot AquaSense X, designed to push pool automation further than before, and the Beatbot Sora 70 , a model focused on dependable, everyday cleaning. Together, they show two distinct approaches to the same problem, with AquaSense X very clearly leading the charge.

title: You can finally grab Oura‚Äôs long-teased charging case
summary: The Oura Ring experience just got more convenient.
body: TL;DR Oura‚Äôs portable charging case is now available after being unveiled back in October. With a built-in battery, the clamshell case holds up to five full charges. It is priced at $99 and can be found on sale at Oura.com and select third-party retailers. Oura‚Äôs long-awaited portable charging case is now officially available for purchase. We first covered the accessory back in October when it was announced alongside the Oura Ring 4 Ceramic collection, and while we‚Äôd hoped to see it hit shelves by the end of 2025, an early January arrival is close enough. Portable charging cases aren‚Äôt a novel idea (brands like RingConn and Samsung already offer their own), but this launch closes a noticeable gap in Oura‚Äôs accessory lineup.

title: Philips will take the hard work out of complex Hue Lights scenes with new update
summary: By being spatially aware of the exact positioning of each compatible smart light.
body: Credit: Jonathan Feist / Android Authority TL;DR An upcoming Philips Hue update will soon let you scan various compatible smart lights spread across a room. You will then be able to create nature-inspired scenes that automatically manage colors and brightness for all lights. In addition, Philips Hue video doorbell and Secure camera will soon also support Apple Home. If you have multiple smart lights and mingle with their different color settings for the perfect mood lighting, Philips Hue has an update that will excite you. Signify, the company behind Philips lighting, has announced a new feature, called ‚ÄúSpatialAware,‚Äù at CES 2026 that will let you set different scenes by using multiple Philips Hue-compatible light sources together. You can use your phone‚Äôs camera to scan the various Philips Hue smart lights spread across any room. The app will create a spatial map of the different placements and automatically design lighting scenarios. In its announcement , Signify says that the feature aims to recreate lighting scenarios inspired by nature. It will automatically manage the colors and intensity of the light to create a harmonious blend.

title: Aurzen‚Äôs CES lineup takes portable projection to the next level
summary: Aurzen is using CES 2026 to debut its tri-fold ZIP Cyber Edition in the US and expand its range of portable projectors.
body: Credit: Chase Bernath / Android Authority CES has no shortage of big-screen tech, but Aurzen‚Äôs focus this year is on portability of projection and how far that idea can be pushed. At CES, Aurzen is showcasing the cream of its projector lineup, with an emphasis on compact designs and use cases that go well beyond the living room. The company‚Äôs presence at the show centres on three product families: the ZIP Cyber Edition, the BOOM series, and a new range of Roku TV‚Äìpowered smart projectors. Together, they frame Aurzen‚Äôs view of portable projection as something flexible enough for travel, cars, and casual home setups.

title: I‚Äôve tested the best smartwatches for Android and iPhone and these are the ones I‚Äôd buy in 2026
summary: Choosing the right wearable doesn't have to be daunting.
body: Smartwatches are no longer a novelty. I see more wrists strapped into wearables than analog timepieces on a daily basis. Yet, a growing market only means more room for competition and a more confusing shopping experience. After testing countless smartwatches over the years, I‚Äôve honed in on what makes a device the most valuable, including user experience, feature set, fitness tracking tools, and sensor package, without forgetting about comfort and looks. Depending on what ecosystem you belong to, the watches below represent the top smartwatches I recommend in 2026 so far. Google Pixel Watch 4: The best smartwatch for Android users When Google first entered the smartwatch space, the Pixel Watch line took a few generations to find its footing. The Pixel Watch 4 absolutely delivers. To start, the newest model offers the most complete Wear OS experience yet, pairing Google‚Äôs Tensor G4 chipset with the powerful Wear OS platform for faster performance, smoother navigation, and stronger integration across the Pixel ecosystem.

title: Motorola Signature phone is here with 7 years of updates, access to luxury experiences
summary: Could this land in the US as the Motorola Edge 70 Ultra?
body: Credit: Motorola TL;DR Motorola has announced the Motorola Signature smartphone. The phone has a slick design and a well-rounded spec sheet, including the Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chip and triple 50MP rear cameras. The Signature also offers seven years of updates and access to exclusive experiences. We first heard about an apparent Motorola Signature phone last month. Fortunately, we didn‚Äôt have to wait long for the unveiling, as Motorola has just launched the device. The Motorola Signature is the first phone in the brand‚Äôs new Signature series, and it emphasizes a slick design and premium extras. Starting with the design, Moto says the phone is 6.99mm thick and has an aluminum frame. The Signature is available in Pantone Martini Olive with a twill-inspired finish, or Pantone Carbon with a linen-inspired finish. Motorola‚Äôs phone also packs Gorilla Glass Victus 2 protection and IP68/69 ratings.

title: I used a $699 Android phone that‚Äôs doing everything Google and Samsung won‚Äôt
summary: An Android phone, in 2026, with a removable battery. We're so back.
body: I just saw something at CES 2026 that felt like a relic of the past: an Android phone with strong privacy features, a removable battery, expandable storage, solid specs, and no AI features. It‚Äôs the type of Android phone that Samsung and Google won‚Äôt make, but another company did, and it‚Äôs called the Punkt MC03. Punkt may not be a household name, but it‚Äôs also not brand new to the smartphone world. The company launched its MC02 phone in February 2024 with the same goal of creating a privacy-focused handset. It wasn‚Äôt a complete success, but it was a promising glimpse into Punkt‚Äôs vision for Android‚Äôs future.

title: Deal: Score massive $140 savings on the 2024 Kindle Scribe
summary: Despite now having a successor, it's still a top-tier device ‚Äî especially with 64GB storage.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority If you‚Äôve ever been tempted by Amazon‚Äôs note-taking Kindle but balked at the price, this deal is worth a look. The top storage variant of the 2024 Kindle Scribe is currently down to $309.99, which is a $140 discount on its usual price. For bargain hunters, it‚Äôs undoubtedly one of the more compelling price drops we‚Äôve seen on Amazon‚Äôs large-format eReader. Kindle Scribe (2024, 64GB) for $309.99 ($140 off)

title: The best thing I found at CES 2026 isn‚Äôt a phone or TV ‚Äî it‚Äôs a $75 smart ring
summary: This is the Pebble Index 01.
body: About a year ago at CES 2025, I met with former Pebble CEO Eric Migicovsky to get a sneak peek at a new product he was working on: a smart ring designed specifically for recording notes and reminders at the press of a button. I was immediately intrigued. That ring was announced as the Pebble Index 01 in December, and at CES 2026 this week, I finally got to try it for myself. It‚Äôs unlike any other smart ring I‚Äôve used before, and while it won‚Äôt be for everyone, it‚Äôs easily one of the best things I‚Äôve found at this year‚Äôs CES.

title: This Duolingo alternative changed the way I learn languages
summary: Speak's speak-first approach is proving to be very bueno.
body: My friend is visiting from Colombia for the holidays, and let‚Äôs just say my 700+ days of studying Spanish on Duolingo is really being put to the test. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I can definitely see the progress I‚Äôve made in my Spanish learning journey. I pick up on things when I hear Spanish, and I‚Äôm usually able to piece together what‚Äôs being said. However, contributing to the conversation is an entirely different beast. Duolingo sprinkles speaking exercises into its lessons, but the functionality feels more like a smaller piece of the puzzle rather than the focus. Speak , another language learning app that I‚Äôve been watching from afar over the last few years, turns this strategy on its head, and the difference has been eye-opening to me. Speak first, sweat the details later

title: OnePlus 15T spec leak reveals a gigantic battery for a compact phone
summary: OnePlus might squeeze a ton of juice into a relatively small smartphone.
body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has claimed that the OnePlus 15T could have a 7,500mAh battery. The phone is also tipped to have a 6.3-inch 165Hz screen, an ultrasonic fingerprint scanner, and a 50MP tele camera. The OnePlus 13S/13T had a very limited release, but we hope the new phone is widely available. OnePlus launched the OnePlus 13T in China last year, which was known as the OnePlus 13s in India. This was a pocket-friendly phone with flagship performance and a big battery. Now, a prominent leaker has revealed apparent details for the OnePlus 15T. Leaker Digital Chat Station posted purported OnePlus 15T specs on Weibo. For one, the device is said to have a flat 6.3-inch 165Hz screen (1.5K resolution). This screen size would be roughly on par with the OnePlus 13T/13S while offering a higher refresh rate.

title: Algae Swirls Across a South African Reservoir
summary: Vivid green blooms form, drift, and fade in Hartbeespoortdam reservoir over the course of a year.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Algae Swirls Across a South‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video June 2022-July 2023 On clear days in Hartbeespoort, South Africa, satellite images often reveal a reservoir with shades of deep blue interrupted by drifting patches of vivid green. These shifting features indicate algae blooms, which can affect water quality, ecosystems, and nearby human communities. In this animation, from June 2022 to July 2023, an algal bloom grows, moves around the reservoir, and then fades. The animation is composed of images from Harmonized Landsat and Sentinel-2 (HLS), a NASA product that combines imagery from the NASA/USGS Landsat 8 and Landsat 9 satellites and th‚Ä¶

title: Let there be light! Wireless light-based Li-Fi looks to solve some of Wi-Fi‚Äôs problems
summary: While limited by direct line-of-sight, Li-Fi is also a lot less vulnerable to interception and jamming.
body: TL;DR Li-Fi is a wireless data system remarkably similar to Wi-Fi, but uses light to send information. Data rates can hit a gigabit a second, while maintaining line-of-sight privacy. pureLiFi is showing off a home solution for using Li-Fi to send data through windows, for outside 5G reception. Old-school smartphone fans didn‚Äôt get started using a Galaxy, iPhone, or even a Nexus ‚Äî back before smartphones as we know them first took form, we had the PDA. But prior to ubiquitous cellular connectivity, communication with PDAs was always a bit of a struggle. One of the more unique solutions to emerge was IrDA, employing infrared light to wirelessly transfer information between devices. Now, over 20 years later, we‚Äôre wondering if light-based wireless communication could be about to make a return. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Lenovo is on a roll at CES: Two new rollable concepts, including one for gamers
summary: Lenovo has been working on rollables for a while, but now it has two new concepts around it.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo showcased two new rollable laptop concepts at CES 2026, one aimed at business users and another designed for high-end esports gaming. The ThinkPad Rollable XD Concept focuses on productivity, featuring a 13.3-inch display that expands to about 16 inches, plus a smaller rear screen for collaboration and more. The Legion Pro Rollable Concept targets gamers, starting at 16 inches and expanding up to 24 inches, with top-tier specs based on the Legion Pro 7i and a dual-motor rollable display system. Lenovo has been experimenting with rollable display technology for years. We have seen several concept devices during that time, and last year the company launched its first commercial laptop with a rollable screen in the form of the Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 . It now seems clear that Lenovo is just getting started. At CES 2026 , the company showed off two new rollable laptop concepts, each aimed at a very different type of user. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Move over, Galaxy Z Fold 7 ‚Äî Motorola just entered the big-fold battle
summary: With strong-looking triple cameras and stylus support, the Razr Fold could be a promising new foldable.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Motorola announced its first book-style foldable phone, the Razr Fold, at CES 2026. It features an 8.1-inch inner display, a large cover screen, triple rear cameras, and Moto Pen support. Set to launch in summer 2026 in the US, pricing and specs like the chipset are yet to be revealed. It‚Äôs been nearly six years since Motorola resurrected the Razr, and it‚Äôs fast become one of our favorite series of flip phones, especially with last year‚Äôs Razr Ultra . At CES 2026 , Motorola revealed that the Razr family will be expanding with the Razr Fold, a book-style foldable to take on competitors like the Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Pixel 10 Pro Fold . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Lenovo unveils a high-power GaN charger and a new combo power bank at CES 2026
summary: Lenovo‚Äôs latest charging gear focuses on power and portability.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo is adding two new charging accessories to its CES 2026 lineup: a 100W multi-port GaN charger and a 140W combo charger and power bank. The 100W charger can handle laptops and phones simultaneously, featuring three USB-C ports with adjustable power levels. The 140W Combo Power Bank serves as both a wall charger and a portable battery, featuring a built-in screen for displaying basic charging information. CES isn‚Äôt just about cutting-edge new laptops, and Lenovo is also using the show to update its charging accessories . Alongside new Yoga and IdeaPad hardware, Lenovo is launching two new power products designed to simplify how you charge multiple devices. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I tried Motorola‚Äôs new Razr Fold, and now I‚Äôm worried about it
summary: I have high hopes, but also more than a few concerns.
body: I take great pride in my reputation as the ‚Äòflip phone guy‚Äô here at Android Authority . Whenever someone needs to go to bat for the small, pocket-friendly form factor, you can almost guarantee that it‚Äôll be me. And yes, that means I‚Äôll be the one to beat the drum for Motorola‚Äôs Razr ‚Äî especially the Razr Ultra ‚Äî harder than anyone. I think it offers the best mix of hardware and software on a flip phone, especially its cover screen. Now, there‚Äôs a new Razr that I should be throwing my support behind. Motorola has just announced its first book-style foldable, the Razr Fold, and I know I should be excited, but I‚Äôm not sure I can be ‚Äî at least not yet. I still have many questions about how the Razr Fold will compete with the likes of the Galaxy Z Fold and Pixel Pro Fold, and I‚Äôm concerned it may not find a large enough audience.

title: Lenovo Legion 7a debuts with thinner and lighter design, alongside a few other gaming machines
summary: Lenovo Legion 7a debuted at CES 2026 with a thinner and lighter design, alongside several other Legion and LOQ products.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo is refreshing the Legion 7a, 5i, and 5a at CES 2026. The Legion 7a is the highest-end model, with support for up to the AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme processor and GeForce RTX 5060 laptop GPU. In addition to the Legion, Lenovo is also refreshing its budget-level LOQ series as well. Lenovo is known for a wide portfolio of computing products that cater to just about everyone, from casual users to business professionals, and even gamers. At CES 2026, the company is refreshing many of its best products across all categories. We‚Äôve already looked at a few of its new Yoga devices ; now it‚Äôs time to take a closer look at the Legion family. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google VP confirms not all Chromebooks will be able to migrate to Aluminium OS
summary: Google VP reaffirms Chrome OS commitment amid shift to Aluminium OS.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The vice president of product management for Chrome OS says Google isn‚Äôt giving up on the operating system. The executive also confirmed that the company will continue to honor its commitment to support Chromebooks with 10 years of automatic updates. Not all Chromebooks will be able to migrate over to Aluminium OS due to technical limitations. It has been known for a while that Google plans to merge Chrome OS and Android into a single desktop platform, codenamed ‚Äú Aluminium OS .‚Äù Unsurprisingly, this knowledge has led to many questions about the fate of Chromebooks and Chrome OS. In an attempt to ease the uncertainty, a Google executive sat down to answer a few questions about the future of the platform. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Meet the Pocket Taco, your next retro mobile gaming controller
summary: This $35 controller brings retro vibes to Android and iOS gaming.
body: Credit: GameSir TL;DR Gaming hardware and accessory maker GameSir has announced its latest mobile controller, the Pocket Taco. Previously known as the Pocket 1, the Pocket Taco is a Game Boy-inspired vertical mobile game controller that clips onto the bottom of your phone. The controller is available for preorder on the company‚Äôs website for $34.99. When it comes to mobile gaming controllers, they‚Äôre a dime a dozen. With options from Backbone, ASUS, Abxylute, 8BitDo, and plenty of others, it can be hard to stand out from the pack. However, GameSir‚Äôs latest controller does its best to be a unique offering by tugging on your nostalgia strings. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This adorable interactive fuzzball wants to be your emotional ally
summary: A cellular upgrade transforms Fuzozo into an emotional partner that's always there when you need it.
body: TL;DR Fuzozo is a sort of half-pet, half-emotional-support-buddy, packed into a Furby-like package. A new upgrade gives Fuzozo cellular connectivity, ensuring access to its AI-based features even when away from home. Over time, users can help their Fuzozo develop a unique personality, and hopefully form an emotional bond. Life in the modern era can be lonely. For many of us, the pandemic really crystalized just how important it is to maintain meaningful connections, but sometimes that‚Äôs easier said than done. If you‚Äôve been struggling to find a fellow human shoulder to lean on, what about the next best thing ‚Äî an AI-powered emotional partner? This year at CES, Tuya and Robopoet are showing off an adorable little fluffball that‚Äôs designed to offer just that. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Breaking: Google will now only release Android source code twice a year
summary: Google has announced that it will publish Android source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4 of each year.
body: The operating system that powers every Android phone and tablet on the market is based on AOSP , short for the Android Open Source Project. Google develops and releases AOSP under the permissive Apache 2.0 License, which allows any developer to use, modify, and distribute their own operating systems based on the project without paying fees or releasing their own modified source code. Since beginning the project, Google released the source code for nearly every new version of Android for mobile devices, typically doing so within days of rolling out the corresponding update to its own Pixel mobile devices. Starting this year, however, Google is making a major change to its release schedule for Android source code drops: AOSP sources will only be released twice a year. Google told Android Authority that, effective 2026, Google will publish new source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4. The reason is to ensure platform stability for the Android ecosystem and better align with Android‚Äôs trunk-stable development model . Developers navigating to source.android.com today will see a banner confirming the change that reads as follows:

title: Google and XREAL are doubling down on their Android XR partnership
summary: Google picks XREAL to lead its Android XR hardware ambitions.
body: TL;DR XREAL and Google have announced a multi-year extension of their partnership. XREAL will now be the lead hardware partner for the Android XR ecosystem. The two companies plan to work on more ‚Äúoptical-see-through devices,‚Äù including wired XR glasses. CES is in full swing and extended reality (XR) device maker XREAL has been busy. Yesterday, the company pulled the covers off its latest pair of XR glasses, the ROG XREAL R1 . Today, the firm has another announcement that involves its future with Google. title: I went hands-on with the Galaxy Z TriFold at CES 2026: The future is here, but also not
summary: An engineering marvel, that feels like a restart.
body: When the original Galaxy Fold landed years ago, it was a clunky, fragile promise of things to come. It took Samsung six years to refine that vision into the Galaxy Z Fold 7 , a device that finally felt thin, light, and ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù Now, here at CES 2026 , I‚Äôve just gone hands-on with the new Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold. It promises to be the next great leap forward: a phone that unfolds not just once, but twice, turning into a legitimate 10-inch tablet.

title: These smart glasses ditch speakers and cameras to focus on real-time translation with captions
summary: Offering near-instant translation for 100+ languages.
body: Credit: Chase Bernath / Android Authority TL;DR LLVision has launched Leion Hey 2 smart glasses that offer real-time translations with subtitles displayed in the lenses. The smart glasses support translations for over 100 languages and are claimed to take less than 500ms to interpret the input. The glasses lack any speakers or cameras to focus on minimal visual cues. For yet another year, we‚Äôre seeing sweeping momentum at CES for gadgets that use AI in some way. At CES 2026 , smart or AR (augmented reality) glasses have been the clear choice for many brands to showcase their strides in AI. LLVision is throwing its hat in the ring, too, with a showcase of its Leion Hey 2 smart glasses at CES 2026. LLVision positions these smart glasses for professional use, with a heavy focus on translation. As per the announcement, the Leion Hey 2 glasses support over ‚Äú100 languages and dialects‚Äù and offer real-time translation with less than half a second of processing delay.

title: Gemini has entered the projector chat
summary: Epson‚Äôs Lifestudio projectors get a Gemini upgrade at CES 2026.
body: TL;DR Epson announces Google TV with Gemini integration for select Lifestudio projectors. Gemini brings more conversational voice control, fine-tuned browsing, and smart-home controls. The rollout begins with newer Lifestudio models and will expand across the entire lineup in 2026. As projectors strive to close the gap with TVs, bigger screens and better brightness are no longer enough; software matters too. Today at CES 2026 , Epson announced that select Lifestudio projectors will soon integrate Google TV with Gemini, bringing Google‚Äôs more conversational AI assistant to the brand‚Äôs big-screen lineup. Gemini has been quietly expanding across Google‚Äôs ecosystem, and the company already announced that Gemini is coming to projectors . Projectors are finally getting software that doesn‚Äôt feel like a compromise compared to modern TVs.

title: Your future color E-Ink wall gallery just got even bigger
summary: InkPoster‚Äôs new A1 frames introduce poster-sized ePaper art.
body: TL;DR InkPoster launched two new A1-sized color E-Ink frames at CES 2026. Both use E-Ink Spectra 6 color ePaper for a print-like impression, but feature differing aesthetics. The poster-sized frames are designed to function as fully cordless wall art, with up to a year of battery life. Color E-Ink isn‚Äôt just for E-Ink tablets anymore, and wall art is one of the more logical places it‚Äôs showing up. The tech offers the flexibility of digital art without the glow, noise, or constant power draw of a traditional screen. After launching its first consumer-friendly color ePaper art poster in 2025, InkPoster returns to CES 2026 with two new A1-size frames that scale the idea up in a big way. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
